channel.title: The Pseudo Show
channel.description: A peek into the lives of filmmakers, musicians, writers, and other artists, exploring their influences and origin stories.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards

channel.itunes:author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
channel.itunes:summary: A peek into the lives of filmmakers, musicians, writers, and other artists, exploring their influences and origin stories.

item.title: 013 - Winter is Coming
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Meredith Strathmeyer, Candice Bergeron, and Damien Patterson of Wonderbound stop by to discuss Winter, the newest collaborative production of the ballet company.
item.content:encoded:
Meredith Strathmeyer, Candice Bergeron, and Damien Patterson of Wonderbound stop by to discuss Winter, the newest collaborative production of the ballet company.

Show Notes

  • Winter on the web
  • Wonderbound homepage

item.title: 012 - The Man Behind Montropo
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Andrés Diaz joins the podcast to discuss his latest musical project Montropo with the debut album Follow Me which has been over 2 years in the making. Learn how Michael and Andrés met and started playing music together.
item.content:encoded:
Andrés Diaz joins the podcast to discuss his latest musical project Montropo with the debut album Follow Me which has been over 2 years in the making. Learn how Michael and Andrés met and started playing music together.

Show Notes

  • Montropo on the web
  • Follow @Montropo on Twitter
  • Montropo on Facebook
  • Smoke & Honey on Facebook
  • Genetic Engines on BandCamp
  • Come Back To Me - short film by Justin Edwards

item.title: 011 - It's Manhattan, Kansas. It's not like a Lot of Hype Can Get to You.
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: The Edwards brothers welcome their father Bruce on to talk about his pop culture influences from growing up in the 50s and 60s. Join us for the fascinating discussion, covering early television, the maturing of fantasy and sci-fi genres, seeing Star Wars Episode IV for the first time, and why Justin was allowed to watch Twin Peaks when he was 9 years old.
item.content:encoded:
The Edwards brothers welcome their father Bruce on to talk about his pop culture influences from growing up in the 50s and 60s. Join us for the fascinating discussion, covering early television, the maturing of fantasy and sci-fi genres, seeing Star Wars Episode IV for the first time, and why Justin was allowed to watch Twin Peaks when he was 9 years old.

Show Notes

  • I Love Lucy pregnancy controversy
  • Happy Days - Garry Marshall on censors and 'virgin'
  • Processing Words: Writing and Revising on a Microcomputer
  • Maverick, starring James Garner and Jack Kelly
  • The Fugitive intro
  • Spielberg's Reese's Pieces product placement
  • Reese's ad with NOT E.T. alien
  • Buckaroo Banzai ending music
  • Aftermash intro
  • THX 1138 original trailer
  • Black Mirror
  • Interplanetary Spy on Archive.org
  • The Pseudobook, including Elite Aliens story

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.

Discuss this episode:
Twitter | Facebook | Google+

The Pseudo Show is hosted by Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards. Check out other Sunrise Robot shows at sunriserobot.net.

Join us for the fascinating discussion, covering early television, the maturing of fantasy and sci-fi genres, seeing Star Wars Episode IV for the first time, and why Justin was allowed to watch Twin Peaks when he was 9 years old.

item.title: 010 - A Conversation with Sarah Tallman
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Sarah Tallman, dancer and choreographer for Wonderbound, sat down for an interview about her new piece prepared for the upcoming production Enduring Grace. Hear about Tallman's influences and creative process as well as the classical dance roots that underpin Wonderbound's modern take on dance, collaborative art and performance.
item.content:encoded:
Sarah Tallman, dancer and choreographer for Wonderbound, sat down for an interview about her new piece prepared for the upcoming production Enduring Grace. Hear about Tallman's influences and creative process as well as the classical dance roots that underpin Wonderbound's modern take on dance, collaborative art and performance.

Show Notes

  • Wonderbound
  • Upcoming Wonderbound Events
  • Sarah Tallman on the web
  • Follow @Sarah_Tallman on Twitter

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.

item.title: 009 - A Young Cruella De Vil
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Justin and Michael discuss the movies of 2014 (so far), separating the wheat from the chaff. Also, what genre or caliber of movie absolutely demands a theater viewing and where do you draw the line?
item.content:encoded:
Justin and Michael discuss the movies of 2014 (so far), separating the wheat from the chaff. Also, what genre or caliber of movie absolutely demands a theater viewing and where do you draw the line?

Show Notes

  • Christopher Nolan: Films of the Future Will Still Draw People to Theaters
  • Interstellar Trailer
  • Birdman Trailer

item.title: 008 - Meet Del Phoena
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Michael and guest-host Sam Worobec talk to Zach and Phoebe of the Portland-based indie-pop duo Del Phoena. In the middle of their first tour, and releasing their debut EP, they discuss how Del Phoena came together and their creative process.
item.content:encoded:
Michael and guest-host Sam Worobec talk to Zach and Phoebe of the Portland-based indie-pop duo Del Phoena. In the middle of their first tour, and releasing their debut EP, they discuss how Del Phoena came together and their creative process.

Show Notes

  • Follow @DelPhoena on Twitter and like them on Facebook
  • Listen to Del Phoena on BandCamp
  • Mystery Machine Studio
  • Nelly - Northeast Northwest
  • Also, follow @sworobec on Twitter!

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.

item.title: 007 - Hey, I Ate At That Restaurant. It's Mine Now.
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Shuchi Talati joins the show to discuss her work in film and storytelling, including her transition from fiction writing and literature studies to film, her experience in the directing program at the American Film Institute, and the joys (and sorrows) of trying to get a feature film made.
item.content:encoded:
Shuchi Talati joins the show to discuss her work in film and storytelling, including her transition from fiction writing and literature studies to film, her experience in the directing program at the American Film Institute, and the joys (and sorrows) of trying to get a feature film made.

Show Notes

  • Shuchi Talati on Vimeo
  • Mae and Ash - Shuchi's AFI short film
  • Guttersnipes on the web, Twitter, and Facebook
  • A Life Ascending - ski documentary
  • The Long Game - history's geniuses are actually losers

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.

Discuss this episode:

item.title: 006 - We All Steal From The Past
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Denver-based singer-songwriter Jesse Manley joins to discuss his creative work in making folk music new again. From his collaborations with the modern ballet company Wonderbound on A Gothic Folktale to his continued work on his own live show, hear about how he is exploring early American folk, blues, and jazz music in all sorts of new collaborations.
item.content:encoded:
Denver-based singer-songwriter Jesse Manley joins to discuss his creative work in making folk music new again. From his collaborations with the modern ballet company Wonderbound on A Gothic Folktale to his continued work on his own live show, hear about how he is exploring early American folk, blues, and jazz music in all sorts of new collaborations.

Show Notes

  • Jesse Manley’s website and Facebook page
  • Jesse performing “Everything That Is” on Open Air CPR
  • Jesse performing “Millie and Christine” on Open Air CPR
  • Jean Ritchie - Careless Love
  • Mississippi John Hurt - Lonesome Valley

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.

item.title: 005 - Green Check Marks
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Justin and Michael welcome their first overseas guest in the form of Matt Duncan. Listen and learn about Matt's musical projects The Astray and Salt The Skies, his seriously impressive cosplay hobby, how he met Michael through Radio Reddit, and, of course, a comprehensive and nuanced appraisal of German and American politics. Ok, maybe not so much that last thing.
item.content:encoded:
Justin and Michael welcome their first overseas guest in the form of Matt Duncan. Listen and learn about Matt's musical projects The Astray and Salt The Skies, his seriously impressive cosplay hobby, how he met Michael through Radio Reddit, and, of course, a comprehensive and nuanced appraisal of German and American politics. Ok, maybe not so much that last thing.

Show Notes

  • Follow Matt on Twitter: @echolox
  • The Astray
  • Salt The Skies
  • Matt's Cosplay
  • Link & Dark Link Cosplay Reddit Thread
  • Terranigma OST
  • ELI5 subreddit (Explain It Like I'm Five)

item.title: 004 - PlayStations and Paradiddles
item.author: Michael Edwards and Justin Edwards
item.description: Benji Robinson, a longtime friend of the Edwards brothers, joins the show to talk about his freelance video and audio production company, his 80s synth project, maxing out the voice memo storage on his phone with song ideas, and his experience as co-composer of the Detective Detective Detective soundtrack.
item.content:encoded:
Benji Robinson, a longtime friend of the Edwards brothers, joins the show to talk about his freelance video and audio production company, his 80s synth project, maxing out the voice memo storage on his phone with song ideas, and his experience as co-composer of the Detective Detective Detective soundtrack.

Show Notes

  • Render Arcade
  • Reptile Ficton
  • MTV Music Generator
  • Benji's music made with MTV Music Generator
  • Gentleman, Want to Take a Look Out Here?
    Circle Back To It
    …both from the Detective Detective Detective OST
  • Follow @benjirobinson on Twitter

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.

Discuss this episode:
Twitter | Facebook | Google+
